page.title: 07ARNPRIOR PETROL STATION
page.content: At the western end of Arnprior village there is a small petrol station /smiddy. It has 3 pumps and each month sells approximately 16500 litres of 4 star petrol, 3500 litres of 2 star petrol and 2000 litres of diesel fuel - mostly to local people, but some to passing travellers. The station is run by one man and his son. Apart from selling petrol they also do blacksmith work. They mend tractors, ploughs, combines and many other types of farm machinery and specialise in welding and forging. They also repair rakes, forks, shovels and all kinds of hand tools commonly used on the farms. They keep a small stock of new tools, fencing materials and so on to sell to the farmers. Until recently horses were shod at the smiddy, and the old coal forge has been replaced by a portable gas forge.
